thread.title: Heavy rain expected for parts of North Island tonight
thread.title_full: Heavy rain expected for parts of North Island tonight

title: Heavy rain expected for parts of North Island tonight
text:
Heavy rain expected for parts of North Island tonight Last updated 17:15, February 8 2017 ROSS GIBLIN/FAIRFAX NZ 
Ah, summer. 
Heavy rains of up to 40mm an hour are expected to hit parts of the Waikato this evening, with thunderstorms possible. 
A separate system of heavy rain is moving up the eastern North Island now, with possible downpours from through southeast Northland, Auckland, and the Coromandel Peninsula overnight. 
MetService have put out a severe thunderstorm watch for the Waikato but the warm temperatures will likely make actual thunderstorms unlikely. MetService 
The two systems hitting the upper North Island on Wednesday evening. 
However, isolated downfalls of up to 40mm an hour are expected from late afternoon through the evening. 
Rainfall of this level can cause flash flooding, particularly around rivers, narrow valleys, and other low-lying areas. 
The complex system causing such rain should move on not long after nightfall. 
The separate system which will hit Auckland, Northland, and the Coromandel around midnight also has a chance of causing heavy rain. MetService have put a severe weather watch out for the area valid until Thursday morning. 
The band of rain is currently causing downpours of up to 20mm in Gisborne, Weatherwatch.co.nz reported. 
Eastern Auckland will see the rain set in for the evening and stick around overnight, possibly getting heavy. A southeasterly change will drop temperatures to 14C. 
The rain will continue throughout Thursday morning but will ease by noon, before fully clearing by the evening.
